intro: Lachenalia versicolor var. fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant lachenalia, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking, colorful inflorescences that display a variety of hues, including pink, red, and white. The plant produces fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, forming a dense rosette near the ground. It is a popular choice for rock gardens and requires well-drained soil and full sun to thrive.
